p: Controlling the response of carbohydrate hydrolysing enzymes ( α-amylase and α-glycosidase) is an effective strategy in facing and/or managing postprandial hyperglycaemia. α-Amylase is endoglucanase, which hydrolyses the internal α-1,4 glycosidic linkage in starch and α-glucosidase is one of the glucosidases located in the brush border surface membrane of intestinal cells, key enzyme for carbohydrate digestion.
